description:
Our computational challenges are so big, complex and unique we can't just purchase off-the-shelf hardware, we've got to make it ourselves. Your team designs and builds the hardware, software and networking technologies that power all of Google's services. As a Hardware Engineer, you design and build the systems that are the heart of the world's largest and most powerful computing infrastructure. You develop from the lowest levels of circuit design to large system design and see those systems all the way through to high volume manufacturing. Your work has the potential to shape the machinery. cutting-edge data centers affecting millions of Google users.

The Chrome OS Hardware team is responsible for developing reference designs for partners and helping them bring devices to market. You are an experienced and self-driven Stylus/Touch/Input Hardware Engineer, who will help drive definition, design, development, and integration of the input subsystems into all Chrome OS consumer products.

Working across the lifecycle of projects, including both technology and product development, you will define testing and qualification plans of the input modules at different stages of the development, from concept to product ramp. With your strong technical, management, and leadership skills, you will work with cross-functional teams to define the specifications of the stylus and touch sensors and execute the development with multiple third-party vendors. You will also lead stylus technology innovations that have significant cross-functional impact.

Google's mission is to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. Our Hardware team researches, designs, and develops new technologies and hardware to make our user's interaction with computing faster, more powerful, and seamless. Whether finding new ways to capture and sense the world around us, advancing form factors, or improving interaction methods, our Hardware team is making people's lives better through technology.

qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering or related field or equivalent practical experience.
  • 3 years of experience with stylus or touch hardware development.
  • Experience with capacitive sensors, their evaluation, manufacturing and testing.
  • Experience managing suppliers.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Master's degree in Electrical Engineering, Power Engineering or related technical field.
  • Experience with stylus for laptop-sized screens (EMR and active types) and capacitive touch module design.
  • Experience with keyboard design: key mechanisms, force profile, travel etc.
  • Knowledge of high volume production and test processes.
  • Strong understanding of touch and stylus system integration.
  • Excellent project management and leadership skills.
responsibilities:
• Work with vendors to ensure high quality input modules for Chrome OS products and with System on Chip (SoC) makers on future interfaces for touch and stylus.
  • Work closely with software team doing driver and user interface for keyboard, touch and stylus.
  • Represent Google's technical position in industry forums and standards working groups.
  • Work closely with cross-functional teams on system integration, tuning and software interface.
  • Travel internationally to vendors’ facilities.
title: Stylus, Touch and Input Hardware Engineer, Chrome OS
